rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.SPDEVID

classVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
classVariables.name: SPDEVID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.NHOID

classVariables.label: Non-Host Organism Identifier
classVariables.name: NHOID
classVariables.notes: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by the lab.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.FETUSID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a fetus associated with a maternal subject, for a particular prenatal evaluation.

classVariables.name: FETUSID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.FOCID

classVariables.examples: A drug application site (e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1"), or a more specific focus (e.g., "OD" (right eye), "Upper left quadrant of the back")
classVariables.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
classVariables.name: FOCID
classVariables.notes: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed. The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--SEQ

classVariables.definition: A number used in combination with the identifier of the subject of the observation to uniquely identify a record within a domain.
classVariables.label: Sequence Number
classVariables.name: --SEQ
classVariables.notes: May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1. Datasets that do not contain subject data, such as the Trial Summary (TS) domain and the Device Tracking (DT) domains, use --SEQ as a sequence number to ensure uniqueness within the dataset.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--GRPID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify related records for a subject within a domain, or related parameters in the Trial Summary (TS) dataset.
classVariables.label: Group ID
classVariables.name: --GRPID
classVariables.notes: See also Section 5.1.6, Trial Summary Information and Section 5.1.7, Challenge Agent Characterization.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--REFID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a source of information.
classVariables.examples: A lab specimen ID, the UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image.
classVariables.label: Reference ID
classVariables.name: --REFID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RECID

classVariables.label: Invariant Record Identifier
classVariables.name: --RECID
classVariables.notes: Identifier for a record that is unique within a domain for a study and that remains invariant through subsequent versions of the dataset, even if the content of the record is modified. When a record is deleted, this value must not be reused to identify another record in either the current or future versions of the domain.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--SPID

classVariables.definition: A sponsor-defined sequence of characters used to identify an instance of an observation.
classVariables.examples: A preprinted line identifier on a Concomitant Medications form.
classVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
classVariables.name: --SPID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--LNKID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a record, for a subject, in one domain and link it to 1 or more records for that subject in another domain.
classVariables.examples: A value that links a single tumor to multiple measurements/assessments performed at different times.
classVariables.label: Link ID
classVariables.name: --LNKID
classVariables.notes: This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--LNKGRP

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a group of records, for a subject, in one domain and link it to 1 or more records for that subject in another domain.
classVariables.examples: A value that links multiple tumor measurement/assessments to a single response to therapy.
classVariables.label: Link Group ID
classVariables.name: --LNKGRP
classVariables.notes: This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--BEATNO

classVariables.name: --BEATNO

classes.description: The majority of observations collected during a study can be divided among three general classes: Interventions, Events, or Findings. Datasets based on any of the general observation classes share a set of common Identifier and Timing variables. As a general rule, any valid Identifier or Timing variable is permissible for use in any submission dataset based on a general observation class. (Source: SDTM v2.0, Section 3.1)
classes.label: General Observations
classes.name: General Observations

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CLASCD

classVariables.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived short sequence of characters used to represent a grouping of drugs, procedures, or therapies.
classVariables.label: Class Code
classVariables.name: --CLASCD
classVariables.notes: Used to represent code for --CLAS.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSE

classVariables.definition: The quantity of an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation) taken or absorbed at a single administration.
classVariables.label: Dose
classVariables.name: --DOSE
classVariables.notes: Not populated when --DOSTXT is populated.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSTXT

classVariables.definition: A textual description of the quantity of an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation) taken or absorbed at a single administration.
classVariables.label: Dose Description
classVariables.name: --DOSTXT
classVariables.notes: Not populated when --DOSE is populated.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSU

classVariables.definition: The unit of measure for the administered agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation), using standardized values.
classVariables.label: Dose Units
classVariables.name: --DOSU
classVariables.notes: Units for --DOSE, --DOSTOT, or --DOSTXT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TDOSD

classVariables.label: Toxic/Physiologic Dose Descr
classVariables.name: --TDOSD
classVariables.notes: A description of a statistically derived estimate of a dose with a certain toxicological or physiological effect in a population, based on data from a dose-response study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--FTDOSD

classVariables.examples: If --TDOSD="LD50" and --FTDOSD="5", then the value represented by --DOSE and --DOSU is 5 times the LD50.
classVariables.label: Factor for Toxic/Physiologic Dose Descr
classVariables.name: --FTDOSD
classVariables.notes: The quantity given for the multiplier of --TDOSD.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSFRM

classVariables.definition: Physical characteristics of a drug product, (e.g., tablet, capsule, or solution) that contains a drug substance, generally (but not necessarily) in association with one or more other ingredients.
classVariables.label: Dose Form
classVariables.name: --DOSFRM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSFRQ

classVariables.definition: The number of times that an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation) is administered per unit of time.
classVariables.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
classVariables.name: --DOSFRQ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSTOT

classVariables.definition: The quantity of an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation) taken or absorbed on a single day.
classVariables.label: Total Daily Dose
classVariables.name: --DOSTOT
classVariables.notes: Uses the units in --DOSU.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSRGM

classVariables.definition: The planned schedule for the administration of an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation).
classVariables.label: Intended Dose Regimen
classVariables.name: --DOSRGM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--ROUTE

classVariables.definition: Designation of the part of the body through which or into which, or the way in which, a substance is introduced.
classVariables.label: Route of Administration
classVariables.name: --ROUTE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LOT

classVariables.definition: An identifier assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product.
classVariables.label: Lot Number
classVariables.name: --LOT
classVariables.notes: Although the identifier for a lot is generally called a lot number, it may contain characters other than digits (e.g., letters).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LOC

classVariables.label: Location of Administration
classVariables.name: --LOC
classVariables.notes: Anatomical location of an intervention, such as an injection site.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--METHOD

classVariables.definition: Method of administration of the treatment.
classVariables.label: Method of Administration
classVariables.name: --METHOD
classVariables.usageRestrictions: Not in human clinical trials; EX domain only

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LAT

classVariables.label: Laterality
classVariables.name: --LAT
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality of intervention administration.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DIR

classVariables.label: Directionality
classVariables.name: --DIR
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing directionality of intervention administration.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PORTOT

classVariables.label: Portion or Totality
classVariables.name: --PORTOT
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of or apportioning of the intervention administration.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--FAST

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether a subject has abstained from food and liquid for a prescribed amount of time.
classVariables.label: Fasting Status
classVariables.name: --FAST
classVariables.notes: Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PSTRG

classVariables.definition: The amount of active ingredient per unit of pharmaceutical dosage form.
classVariables.label: Pharmaceutical Strength
classVariables.name: --PSTRG

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PSTRGU

classVariables.definition: The unit of measure for the amount of active ingredient per unit of pharmaceutical dosage form, using standardized values.
classVariables.label: Pharmaceutical Strength Units
classVariables.name: --PSTRGU
classVariables.notes: Unit for --PSTRG.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TRTV

classVariables.definition: A carrier or inert medium in which a medicinally active agent is administered.
classVariables.label: Treatment Vehicle
classVariables.name: --TRTV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--VAMT

classVariables.definition: Amount of the prepared product (treatment plus vehicle) administered.
classVariables.label: Treatment Vehicle Amount
classVariables.name: --VAMT
classVariables.notes: Note: Should not be diluent amount alone.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--VAMTU

classVariables.definition: The unit of measure for the prepared product (treatment plus vehicle) using standardized values.
classVariables.label: Treatment Vehicle Amount Units
classVariables.name: --VAMTU

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--ADJ

classVariables.definition: The explanation given for why a dose was changed as compared to a previous dose.
classVariables.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
classVariables.name: --ADJ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--RSDISC

classVariables.label: Reason for Treatment Discontinuation
classVariables.name: --RSDISC
classVariables.notes: Reason the treatment was discontinued.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--USCHFL

classVariables.definition: An indication that the performed test or observation was done at a time that was not planned.
classVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
classVariables.name: --USCHFL
classVariables.notes: If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are "Y" or null. This variable would not be needed when information on planned assessments is provided, such as when the Trial Visits (TV) and Subject Visits (SV) domains are used.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--RSTIND

classVariables.label: Restraint Indicator
classVariables.name: --RSTIND
classVariables.notes: An indicator as to whether the animal subject was restrained during the intervention period. Expected values are "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--RSTMOD

classVariables.label: Restraint Mode
classVariables.name: --RSTMOD
classVariables.notes: A description of whether the restraint was physical and/or chemical.

classes.description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, INTERVENTIONS, 2021-09-24)
classes.label: Interventions
classes.name: Interventions

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TERM

classVariables.definition: The collected name for an event observation.
classVariables.label: Reported Term
classVariables.name: --TERM
classVariables.notes: The verbatim or prespecified name of the event.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--MODIFY

classVariables.definition: A value which represents an alteration to a collected value for coding.
classVariables.label: Modified Reported Term
classVariables.name: --MODIFY
classVariables.notes: If the value for --TERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LLT

classVariables.definition: The lowest-level term assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: Lowest Level Term
classVariables.name: --LLT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LLTCD

classVariables.definition: The lowest-level term code assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: Lowest Level Term Code
classVariables.name: --LLTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--DECOD

classVariables.definition: Standardized or dictionary-derived text for the description of an event or intervention.
classVariables.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
classVariables.name: --DECOD
classVariables.notes: Equivalent to the Preferred Term ("PT" in MedDRA).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--EVDTYP

classVariables.label: Medical History Event Date Type
classVariables.name: --EVDTYP
classVariables.notes: Specifies the aspect of the medical condition or event by which MHSTDTC and/or the MHENDTC is defined.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PTCD

classVariables.definition: The preferred term code assigned to the event from the MedDRA dictionary.
classVariables.label: Preferred Term Code
classVariables.name: --PTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLT

classVariables.definition: The high-level term from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: High Level Term
classVariables.name: --HLT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLTCD

classVariables.definition: The high-level term code from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: High Level Term Code
classVariables.name: --HLTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLGT

classVariables.definition: The high-level group term from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: High Level Group Term
classVariables.name: --HLGT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLGTCD

classVariables.definition: The high-level group term code from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: High Level Group Term Code
classVariables.name: --HLGTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CAT

classVariables.definition: A grouping or classification of the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariables.label: Category
classVariables.name: --CAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCAT

classVariables.definition: A further grouping or classification of the category for the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariables.label: Subcategory
classVariables.name: --SCAT
classVariables.notes: The category is in --CAT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PRESP

classVariables.definition: An indication that the event or intervention was prospectively stated or detailed on the CRF.
classVariables.label: Pre-Specified
classVariables.name: --PRESP
classVariables.notes: Value is "Y" for prespecified events, null for spontaneously reported events.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--OCCUR

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether a prespecified event or intervention has occurred.
classVariables.label: Occurrence Indicator
classVariables.name: --OCCUR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REASOC

classVariables.label: Reason for Occur Value
classVariables.name: --REASOC
classVariables.notes: --REASOC is the reason the event did or did not occur, according to the value in --OCCUR.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--STAT

classVariables.label: Completion Status
classVariables.name: --STAT
classVariables.notes: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a prespecified event was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REASND

classVariables.definition: The explanation for why requested information was not available.
classVariables.label: Reason Not Done
classVariables.name: --REASND
classVariables.notes: Used in conjunction with --STAT when its value is "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--BODSYS

classVariables.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived name for the body system or organ class.
classVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class
classVariables.name: --BODSYS
classVariables.notes: Body system or system organ class assigned for analysis from a standard hierarchy (e.g., MedDRA) associated with an event.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--BDSYCD

classVariables.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived short sequence of characters used to represent the body system or organ class.
classVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class Code
classVariables.name: --BDSYCD
classVariables.notes: MedDRA System Organ Class code corresponding to --BODSYS assigned for analysis.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SOC

classVariables.definition: The system organ class from the primary hierarchy assigned in the MedDRA dictionary.
classVariables.label: Primary System Organ Class
classVariables.name: --SOC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SOCCD

classVariables.definition: The system organ class code from the primary hierarchy assigned in the MedDRA dictionary.
classVariables.label: Primary System Organ Class Code
classVariables.name: --SOCCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CNTMOD

classVariables.label: Contact Mode
classVariables.name: --CNTMOD
classVariables.notes: The way in which the event, visit, or contact was conducted.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--EPCHGI

classVariables.label: Epi/Pandemic Related Change Indicator
classVariables.name: --EPCHGI
classVariables.notes: Indicates whether the event was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic. Not the same as whether a medical condition was caused by an epidemic or pandemic.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LOC

classVariables.label: Location of Event
classVariables.name: --LOC
classVariables.notes: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LAT

classVariables.label: Laterality
classVariables.name: --LAT
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing laterality.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--DIR

classVariables.label: Directionality
classVariables.name: --DIR
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing directionality.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PORTOT

classVariables.label: Portion or Totality
classVariables.name: --PORTOT
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PARTY

classVariables.definition: The role of the individual or entity responsible for the receipt of the transferred object (e.g., device, specimen).
classVariables.label: Accountable Party
classVariables.name: --PARTY
classVariables.notes: The party could be an individual (e.g., subject), an organization (e.g., sponsor), or a location that is a proxy for an individual or organization (e.g., site). It is usually a somewhat general term that is further identified in the --PRTYID variable.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PRTYID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify the individual or entity responsible for the receipt of the transferred object (e.g., device, specimen).
classVariables.label: Identification of Accountable Party
classVariables.name: --PRTYID
classVariables.notes: Used in conjunction with --PARTY.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SEV

classVariables.definition: The quality or degree of harm associated with a finding or event, as collected.
classVariables.label: Severity/Intensity
classVariables.name: --SEV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SER

classVariables.definition: A collected indication as to whether an event meets regulatory criteria for seriousness.
classVariables.label: Serious Event
classVariables.name: --SER
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y" and "N".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACN

classVariables.definition: An action taken with study treatment as the result of the event.
classVariables.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
classVariables.name: --ACN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACNOTH

classVariables.definition: An action taken unrelated to study treatment, as the result of the event.
classVariables.label: Other Action Taken
classVariables.name: --ACNOTH

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACNDEV

classVariables.definition: An action taken with a device as the result of the event.
classVariables.label: Action Taken with Device
classVariables.name: --ACNDEV
classVariables.notes: The device may or may not be the device under study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REL

classVariables.definition: The investigator's assessment of the likelihood that the study treatment was the cause of the event.
classVariables.label: Causality
classVariables.name: --REL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RLDEV

classVariables.definition: A judgement as to the likelihood that the device caused the event.
classVariables.label: Relationship of Event to Device
classVariables.name: --RLDEV
classVariables.notes: The device may or may not be the device under study. Controlled terminology from EC Directive MEDDEV 2.7/3 March 2015 is required in EU but not US.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RELNST

classVariables.definition: The investigator's assessment of the causal relationship of the event to a non-study treatment.
classVariables.examples: MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE
classVariables.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
classVariables.name: --RELNST

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PATT

classVariables.definition: A characterization of the temporal pattern of occurrences of the event.
classVariables.label: Pattern of Event
classVariables.name: --PATT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--OUT

classVariables.definition: The status associated with the result or conclusion of the event.
classVariables.label: Outcome of Event
classVariables.name: --OUT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCAN

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event was serious was because the event was associated with cancer.
classVariables.label: Involves Cancer
classVariables.name: --SCAN
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCONG

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event is associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect in an offspring of the subject.
classVariables.label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
classVariables.name: --SCONG
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SDISAB

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in a significant, persistent, or permanent change, impairment, damage, or disruption in the subject's body function/structure, physical activities, and/or quality of life.
classVariables.label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
classVariables.name: --SDISAB
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SDTH

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in death.
classVariables.label: Results in Death
classVariables.name: --SDTH
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SHOSP

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in or prolonged hospitalization.
classVariables.label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
classVariables.name: --SHOSP
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SLIFE

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in a substantial risk of dying.
classVariables.label: Is Life Threatening
classVariables.name: --SLIFE
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SOD

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event is associated with overdose.
classVariables.label: Occurred with Overdose
classVariables.name: --SOD
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SMIE

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event may jeopardize the subject and may require intervention to prevent one of the other outcomes associated with serious adverse events.
classVariables.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
classVariables.name: --SMIE
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SINTV

classVariables.label: Needs Intervention to Prevent Impairment
classVariables.name: --SINTV
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null. Expected use is in medical device-related trials. It is part of the definition of a serious AE as represented in 21 CFR Part 803.3(w)(3). \n Records whether medical or surgical intervention was necessary to preclude permanent impairment of a body function, or prevent permanent damage to a body structure, with either situation suspected to be due to the use of a medical product.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--UNANT

classVariables.label: Unanticipated Adverse Device Effect
classVariables.name: --UNANT
classVariables.notes: The assessment is about a device identified in the data (i.e., which has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. \n Any serious adverse effect on health or safety or any life-threatening problem or death caused by or associated with a device, if that effect, problem, or death was not previously identified in nature, severity, or degree of incidence in the investigational plan or application (including a supplementary plan or application), or any other unanticipated serious problem associated with a device that relates to the rights, safety, or welfare of subjects. (21 CFR 812.3(s)).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RLPRT

self.title: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure

classVariables.label: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure
classVariables.name: --RLPRT
classVariables.notes: The investigator's opinion as to the likelihood that the device-related study procedure caused the AE (e.g., implant/insertion, revision/adjustment, explant/removal) \n The relationship is to a device-related procedure where the device is identified in the data (i.e., which has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RLPRC

self.title: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity

classVariables.label: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity
classVariables.name: --RLPRC
classVariables.notes: The investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event as related to other protocol-required activities, actions or assessments (e.g., medication changes, tests/assessments, other procedures). \n The relationship is to a protocol-specified non-device-related activity where the device is identified in the data (i.e., which has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CONTRT

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether a non-study treatment was given because of the occurrence of the event.
classVariables.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
classVariables.name: --CONTRT
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TOX

classVariables.definition: The standardized or dictionary-derived name for an untoward event or finding.
classVariables.label: Toxicity
classVariables.name: --TOX
classVariables.notes: Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TOXGR

classVariables.definition: A categorical classification of the severity of an event or finding, based on a standard scale, used in study data tabulation.
classVariables.examples: A toxicity grade from the NCI CTCAE.
classVariables.label: Toxicity Grade
classVariables.name: --TOXGR
classVariables.notes: Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--USCHFL

classVariables.definition: An indication that the performed test or observation was done at a time that was not planned.
classVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
classVariables.name: --USCHFL
classVariables.notes: If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are "Y" or null. This variable would not be needed when information on planned assessments is provided, such as when the Trial Visits (TV) and Subject Visits (SV) domains are used.

(Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, EVENTS, 2021-09-24)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--SBMRKS

classVariables.examples: Three unnamed sublineages of monocytes have been identified: CCR2+CD16-; CCR2-CD16+; and CCR2+CD16+. Whereas the entire monocyte cell population can be defined as CD14+ cells, the additional CCR2 and CD16 markers are used to differentiate one sublineage from another, none of which has yet been given a name by the scientific community. By combining the CPTEST value of "Monocyte Subset" with the value of "CCR2+CD16-" in CPSBMRKS, the full test is defined to be the CCR2+CD16- monocyte subpopulation.
classVariables.label: Sublineage Marker String
classVariables.name: --SBMRKS
classVariables.notes: Used to further subset the cell population identified in CPTEST based on the use of additional marker(s) that define a sublineage. The value in CPSBMRKS is used in combination with values in CPTEST and CPCELSTA to fully describe the cell population being measured. As such, it is an essential component of the full test name.

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CELSTA

classVariables.label: Cell State
classVariables.name: --CELSTA
classVariables.notes: A textual description of a subset of the cell population identified in CPTEST based on a particular functional and/or biological state (e.g., primed, activated, proliferating, senescent, G2-arrested). When populated, the values in CPCELSTA and CPSMRKS, in combination with values in CPTEST and CPSBMRKS, fully describe the cell population being measured.

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CSMRKS

classVariables.examples: When Ki67 expression is used to determine that a cell population is in a proliferating state (i.e., CPCELSTA value = "PROLIFERATING"), the value "Ki67+" in CPCSMRKS indicates that positive expression of Ki67 was used to define the population as proliferating. Similarly, a value of "Ki67-" in CPCSMRKS would indicate that lack of expression of Ki67 defined the "NON-PROLIFERATING" cell state in CPCELSTA. The CPCSMRKS value is useful for quickly determining which marker(s) were used to classify (i.e., operationally define) a cell population based on a functional/biological state.
classVariables.label: Cell State Marker String
classVariables.name: --CSMRKS
classVariables.notes: Identifies the marker(s) or indicator(s) used to define the cell state (i.e., the value in CPCELSTA).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CNTMOD

classVariables.label: Contact Mode
classVariables.name: --CNTMOD

classVariables.name: --EPCHGI
classVariables.notes: Indicates whether the measurement, test, or examination was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTCND

classVariables.examples: Stimulating or activating agents, assay temperature, incubation time \n "STIMULATED", "NON-STIMULATED", "25 C", "37 C".
classVariables.label: Test Condition
classVariables.name: --TSTCND
classVariables.notes: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--CNDAGT

classVariables.examples: "Phorbol myristate acetate", "Concanavalin A, PHA-P", "TNF-alpha, Ionomycin", "Candida antigen"
classVariables.label: Test Condition Agent
classVariables.name: --CNDAGT
classVariables.notes: The textual description of the agent used to impose a test condition identified in CPTSTCND. For example, records might be produced for the same test run under stimulating (CPTSTCND value = "STIMULATED") conditions produced by different stimulating agents.
classVariables.usageRestrictions: CP, IS, and LB domains only

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--BDAGNT

classVariables.label: Binding Agent
classVariables.name: --BDAGNT
classVariables.notes: The textual description of the agent that's binding to the entity in the --TEST variable. The --BDAGNT variable is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the --TEST and --BDAGNT variables, regardless of direction.--BDAGNT is not a method qualifier. It should only be used when the actual interest of the measurement is the binding interaction between the two entities in --TEST and --BDAGNT. In other words, the combination of --TEST and --BDAGNT should describe the thing, the entity, or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. \n The binding agent may be, but is not limited to, a test article, a portion of the test article, a related compound, an endogenous molecule, an allergen, or an infectious agent.
classVariables.usageRestrictions: CP, IS, and LB domains only

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--ABCLID

classVariables.label: Antibody Clone Identifier
classVariables.name: --ABCLID
classVariables.notes: Identifies the antibody clone (e.g., supplier-provided catalog name) used to confer specificity for the binding agent specified in CPBDAGNT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--MRKSTR

classVariables.label: Marker String
classVariables.name: --MRKSTR
classVariables.notes: The text string identifying the full set of markers/indicators used by the laboratory to operationally define the complete test. Because laboratories often use different markers/indicators to identify a cell population, the relationship between a named cell population in CPTEST (as combined with CPSBMRKS and CPCELSTA values) and the set of markers used to identify that population is many-to-one. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different sets of markers, it is necessary to operationally define the test in terms of the markers/indicators used to perform that test.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--GATE

classVariables.label: Gate
classVariables.name: --GATE
classVariables.notes: The sponsor-defined name assigned to a gate. Gates are electronic (device setting or software-defined) boundaries set by a user to virtually parse a specimen into discrete populations based on a set of defined characteristics (e.g., presence, absence, or intensity of expression of various markers; physical size; internal complexity or granularity). Gates are used to constrain data collection or analysis to a specific cell population or region of interest within the specimen.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--GATDEF

classVariables.label: Gate Definition
classVariables.name: --GATDEF
classVariables.notes: The text string identifying the set of parameters and the order in which they are applied to define the gating strategy. In practice, a series of 2-dimensional subgates based on 2 different cell characteristics (i.e., markers/indicators/physical properties) are most often combined until the cell population of interest is sufficiently resolved (i.e., electronically isolated) from other cell populations contained within the specimen. \n For complex analyses, differences in gating strategies can produce subtle differences in results obtained for a test. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different gating strategies, it is often necessary to qualify the test in terms of the gating strategy. For some purposes, however, and at the discretion of the sponsor, only the ultimate or penultimate gate is identified. When specifying the gating strategy in CPGATDEF, each subgate should be listed in the order it was applied and separated from the next sub-gate using the vertical line or pipe character ("|").

qualifiesVariables.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Findings.--TSTOPO

classVariables.label: Test Operational Objective
classVariables.name: --TSTOPO
classVariables.notes: The textual description of the high-level purpose of the test at the operational level.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AssociatedPersons.SREL

classVariables.label: Subject, Device, or Study Relationship
classVariables.name: SREL
classVariables.notes: If RSUBJID is populated, describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the subject or pool identified in RSUBJID. \n If RDEVID is populated, describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the device identified in RDEVID. \n If RSUBJID and RDEVID are null, SREL describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the study identified in STUDYID.

classes.description: Associated persons are individuals other than study subjects who can be associated with a study, a particular study subject, or a device used in the study. The structures of SDTM datasets that represent data about associated persons are based on the structures for data about study subjects, either general observation class structures or special-purpose domain structures. AP domains are created using SDTM variables, with the application of specific AP rules. (Source: SDTM v2.0, Section 4)
classes.label: Associated Persons
classes.name: Associated Persons

classes.name: Relationship

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "DM".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.USUBJID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SUBJID

datasetVariables.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
datasetVariables.name: SUBJID
datasetVariables.notes: Subject identifier, which must be unique within the study. Often the ID of the subject as recorded on a CRF.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFSTDTC

datasetVariables.definition: The start date or date and time of the sponsor-defined study reference period, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Reference Start Date/Time
datasetVariables.name: RFSTDTC
datasetVariables.notes: Usually equivalent to date/time when subject was first exposed to study treatment. Required for all randomized subjects; will be null for all subjects who did not meet the milestone the date requires, such as screen failures or unassigned subjects.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFENDTC

datasetVariables.definition: The end date or date and time of the sponsor-defined study reference period, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Reference End Date/Time
datasetVariables.name: RFENDTC
datasetVariables.notes: Usually equivalent to the date/time when a subject was determined to have ended the trial. Often equivalent to either date/time of last exposure to study treatment or date/time of last contact with the subject. Required for all randomized subjects; null for screen failures or unassigned subjects.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFXSTDTC

datasetVariables.definition: The start date or date and time of the first exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of First Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: RFXSTDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFXENDTC

datasetVariables.definition: The end date or date and time of the last exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Last Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: RFXENDTC

priorVersion.title: Date/Time of First Challenge Agent Admin

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFCSTDTC

self.title: Date/Time of First Challenge Agent Admin

datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of First Challenge Agent Admin
datasetVariables.name: RFCSTDTC
datasetVariables.notes: The start date or date and time of the first exposure to any protocol-specified challenge agent that induces the disease or condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent, represented in a standardized character format. \n Equal to the earliest value of AGSTDTC for the challenge agent.

priorVersion.title: Date/Time of Last Challenge Agent Admin

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFCENDTC

self.title: Date/Time of Last Challenge Agent Admin

datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Last Challenge Agent Admin
datasetVariables.name: RFCENDTC
datasetVariables.notes: The end date or date and time of the last exposure to any protocol-specified challenge agent that induces the disease or condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent, represented in a standardized character format. \n Equal to the latest value of AGENDTC for the challenge agent.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFICDTC

datasetVariables.definition: The date or date and time of informed consent, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Informed Consent
datasetVariables.name: RFICDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RFPENDTC

datasetVariables.definition: The date or date and time of last contact with or information about a subject in a trial, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of End of Participation
datasetVariables.name: RFPENDTC
datasetVariables.notes: Should correspond to the last known date of contact.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.DTHDTC

datasetVariables.definition: The date or date and time of death, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Death
datasetVariables.name: DTHDTC
datasetVariables.notes: Should represent the date/time that is captured in the clinical-trial database.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.DTHFL

datasetVariables.definition: An indication that the subject died.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Death Flag
datasetVariables.name: DTHFL
datasetVariables.notes: A value of "Y" indicates the subject died. Should be "Y" or null. Should be populated even when the death date is unknown.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SITEID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify the facility associated with study-specific activities.
datasetVariables.label: Study Site Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SITEID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.INVID

datasetVariables.label: Investigator Identifier
datasetVariables.name: INVID
datasetVariables.notes: An identifier to describe the Investigator for the study. May be used in addition to the SITEID. Not needed if SITEID is equivalent to INVID.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.INVNAM

datasetVariables.label: Investigator Name
datasetVariables.name: INVNAM
datasetVariables.notes: Name of the investigator for a site.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.BRTHDTC

datasetVariables.definition: The date or date and time of birth, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Birth
datasetVariables.name: BRTHDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.AGE

datasetVariables.definition: A numeric representation of the elapsed time since birth at a specific point in time defined for the trial, used for study data tabulation.
datasetVariables.label: Age
datasetVariables.name: AGE
datasetVariables.notes: May be derived as (RFSTDTC-BRTHDTC), but BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.AGETXT

datasetVariables.definition: The age at a specific point in time defined for the trial, expressed as a range.
datasetVariables.label: Age Text
datasetVariables.name: AGETXT
datasetVariables.notes: The age of the subject at study start, as planned, expressed as a range. If an age integer value is available, then populate the age variable instead. Either the AGE or AGETXT variable should be populated, but not both.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.AGEU

datasetVariables.definition: The unit of time used to express the age, using standardized values.
datasetVariables.label: Age Units
datasetVariables.name: AGEU

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SEX

datasetVariables.label: Sex
datasetVariables.name: SEX
datasetVariables.notes: Sex of the subject.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RACE

datasetVariables.label: Race
datasetVariables.name: RACE
datasetVariables.notes: Race of the subject. Sponsors should refer to FDA guidance regarding the collection of race data.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ETHNIC

datasetVariables.label: Ethnicity
datasetVariables.name: ETHNIC
datasetVariables.notes: The ethnicity of the subject. Sponsors should refer to FDA guidance regarding the collection of ethnicity data.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SPECIES

datasetVariables.definition: The common (non-taxonomic) name for an animal used as the test system in a study.
datasetVariables.label: Species
datasetVariables.name: SPECIES

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.STRAIN

datasetVariables.definition: The vendor-supplied species/strain/substrain designation for the test system under study. It may combine the species, background strain, substrain, and associated genetic modifications as supplied by the vendor (e.g. FISCHER 344, SPRAGUE-DAWLEY IGS, WISTAR Kyoto, BEAGLE, CYNOMOLGUS, RHESUS, CHIMPANZEE).
datasetVariables.label: Strain/Substrain
datasetVariables.name: STRAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SBSTRAIN

datasetVariables.definition: Additional clarifying details regarding the test system under study, such as a description of a phenotypic alteration associated with the specific genetic modification captured or collected in the Strain/Substrain variable.
datasetVariables.label: Strain/Substrain Details
datasetVariables.name: SBSTRAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ARMCD

datasetVariables.definition: A short sequence of characters that represents the planned arm to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ARMCD
datasetVariables.notes: Limited to 20 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ARM

datasetVariables.definition: The name of the planned arm to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariables.name: ARM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ACTARMCD

datasetVariables.definition: A short sequence of characters that represents the arm in which the subject actually participated.
datasetVariables.label: Actual Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ACTARMCD
datasetVariables.notes: Limited to 20 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ACTARM

datasetVariables.definition: The name of the arm in which the subject actually participated.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Actual Arm
datasetVariables.name: ACTARM

priorVersion.title: Reason Arm and/or Actual Arm is Null

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ARMNRS

self.title: Reason Arm and/or Actual Arm is Null

datasetVariables.label: Reason Arm and/or Actual Arm is Null
datasetVariables.name: ARMNRS
datasetVariables.notes: The reason why the actual arm variables are null or why both the planned and actual arm variables are null. It is assumed that if the arm and actual arm variables are null, the same reason applies to both.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.ACTARMUD

datasetVariables.label: Description of Unplanned Actual Arm
datasetVariables.name: ACTARMUD
datasetVariables.notes: A description of actual treatment for a subject who did not receive treatment described in one of the planned trial arms.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.SETCD

datasetVariables.definition: The standardized or dictionary-derived short sequence of characters used to represent the trial set.
datasetVariables.label: Set Code
datasetVariables.name: SETCD
datasetVariables.notes: Defined by the sponsor (see Section 5.1.2, Trial Sets). Maximum of 8 characters. This represents the code for the trial set for which parameters are being submitted.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.RPATHCD

datasetVariables.definition: A short sequence of characters that represents the planned reproductive path to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Repro Path Code
datasetVariables.name: RPATHCD
datasetVariables.notes: Limited to 20 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.COUNTRY

datasetVariables.definition: The country in which the investigational site is located.
datasetVariables.label: Country
datasetVariables.name: COUNTRY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.DMDTC

datasetVariables.definition: The date or date and time of demographic data collection, represented in a standardized character format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Collection
datasetVariables.name: DMDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DM.DMDY

datasetVariables.definition: The actual study day of demographic data collection derived relative to the sponsor-defined reference start date.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Collection
datasetVariables.name: DMDY
datasetVariables.notes: The sponsor-defined reference start date is RFSTDTC.

datasets.description: A special-purpose domain that includes a set of essential standard variables that describe each subject in a clinical study. It is the parent domain for all other observations for human clinical subjects.
datasets.label: Demographics
datasets.name: DM

datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation

datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

datasetVariables.name: COSEQ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable CO.IDVAR

datasetVariables.label: Identifying Variable
datasetVariables.name: IDVAR
datasetVariables.notes: Identifying variable in the parent dataset that identifies the record(s) to which the comment applies (e.g., AESEQ, CMGRPID). Used only when individual comments are related to domain records. Null for comments collected on separate CRFs.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable CO.IDVARVAL

datasetVariables.label: Identifying Variable Value
datasetVariables.name: IDVARVAL
datasetVariables.notes: Value of identifying variable of the parent record(s). Null for comments collected on separate CRFs.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable CO.COREF

datasetVariables.examples: A CRF page number (e.g., 650), a module name (e.g., "DEMOG"), or a combination of information that identifies the reference (e.g., "650-VITALS-VISIT 2")
datasetVariables.label: Comment Reference
datasetVariables.name: COREF
datasetVariables.notes: Sponsor-defined reference associated with the comment.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable CO.COVAL

datasetVariables.label: Comment
datasetVariables.name: COVAL
datasetVariables.notes: The text of the comment. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns COVAL1-COVALn.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable CO.COEVAL

datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: COEVAL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable CO.COEVALID

datasetVariables.label: Evaluator Identifier
datasetVariables.name: COEVALID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable CO.CODTC

datasetVariables.name: CODTC
datasetVariables.notes: Date or date and time of comment on dedicated comment form, if collected. Should be null if this is a child record of another domain or if comment date was not collected.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable CO.CODY

datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Comment
datasetVariables.name: CODY
datasetVariables.notes: Actual study day of the comment, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.

datasets.description: A special-purpose domain that contains comments that may be collected alongside other data.
